messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Wishes of Merry Christmas and Happy New Year!
messages.msgSnippet: meri kurisimasu1 welcome to our small little world, where a honor is stronger than steel...=)..as for all you out there,id like to contribute my two kokus
messages.messageBody:
meri kurisimasu1 welcome to our small little world, where a honor is stronger
than steel...=)..as for all you out there,id like to contribute my two kokus
wprth of suggestions,try checking out the book "samurai sketches",the book is
about the last few years of the tokugawa shogunate and it focuses on the
samurais who serve the shogunate,and their opponents who wish to reinstate
the powers of the emperor,its a must read book,unfortunately im not sure if
there is a spanish version because the copy i have is a english one..well
meri kurisimasu every1 and happy holidays! Kantorai-shido!

messages.subject: Wishes of Merry Christmas and Happy New Year!
messages.msgSnippet: Hello My name is Penteado, Antenor Penteado. I am a new member of this group, so I would like to say nice to meet you to all the members and wish a merry
messages.messageBody:
Hello My name is Penteado, Antenor Penteado. I am a new member of this
group, so I would like to say nice to meet you to all the members and wish a
merry christmas and happy new year. I am a brazilian lawyer who love Samurai
Culture and history and along my 61 years of age I have been reading about
such involving culture that I love.
It is a pleasure to be in touch with other people that enjoy getting to know
more and more about the Samurais and their history! There is a very
interesting book about Bushido that I would like to recommend you highly. It
is published in Spain and its title is " Zen y Artes Marciales" (Zen and
Marcial Arts) The writer is Taisen Deshimaru a master in Zen. Luiz Cï¿½rcamo
Editor. San Raimundo, 58 - Madrid. This is one of the books I like the most
about Zen and Marcial Arts. I know that there is a french edition, but I am
not quite sure if there is an english edition yet.
I have just read the new biography written about Miyamoto Musashi that has
some information about "Bo-jutsu".
I like Bo-jutsu and I would like to receive some information about the
wooden bastons, its size and interesting information about this art!
so, once more nice to meet you!
I am sorry for my poor english
best wishes.
Antenor C. Penteado
